job_description:
Back Sr. Business Analyst Officer - Corporate App Tech Support # Bowie, Maryland, United States Apply X Facebook LinkedIn Email Copy Location

This position is 100% remote within the Bank's footprint. Employee will work full time remote outside of a WesBanco location (may occasionally attend in person meetings, although primary functions of the role are performed remotely).
Market Mid-Atlantic Work Hours per Week 40 Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in technology or another related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience required.

Minimum five years experience in banking, technology, or another related field required.

Strong knowledge of customer and user system experiences required.

Advanced technical skills are not required; but knowledge of system components and user experience is highly required.

Experience supporting digital banking, electronic banking, commercial online banking including mobile apps required.

Experience with deposit and/or loan operations required.

Experience with ACH payments, including knowledge of National Automated Clearing House Association (NACHA) file layout and rules required.

Must demonstrate experience with leading successful technology projects as well as working with various business lines to achieve optimal results.

Experience in creating business requirements, test plans, project plans and other technology project related documentation desired.
Job Description

SUMMARY:

Technology is at the center of all products and services we offer to our customers; and the alignment of these technical solutions with the needs of the business lines is paramount to the success of WesBanco. The Sr. Business Analyst Officer is responsible for bridging the gap between the changing needs of our external and internal customers and the ever-advancing technological solutions that support those needs. Each Sr. Business Analyst Officer will ultimately oversee their assigned business areas and application(s) to ensure that we are fully leveraging technology to efficiently and effectively meet the user needs.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Consults with key stakeholders to determine business objectives and success factors.

Collaborates with business area to collect, analyze and evaluate information related to business systems.

Documents business requirements, functional requirements, and design specifications.

Coordinates with the application analyst counterpart to document technical requirements.

Analyzes and manages new and existing system utilization by the end user.

Assists in the development of training materials to ensure proper usage and highest optimization of the applications.

Serves as an expert in business system solutions in alignment with assigned business area.

Serves as a liaison between the assigned business area and third-party vendors and Information Technology (IT) resources.

Makes system recommendations and other solution suggestions to meet customer needs and/or improve processes.

Monitors system deliverables to ensure business needs are met successfully and within agreed upon timeframes.

Assists in troubleshooting problems within the business application solution set and engages IT and third-party vendors as needed.

Fosters strong relationships with supporting vendors, IT teams, and supported business area.

Opens and tracks support tickets and feature requests.

Responsible for the work effort within assigned applications during acquisitions.

Tests new functionality and documents test plans in correlation with the business area.

Manages the lifecycle of support applications including the roadmaps, releases, upgrades and defect tracking.

Maintains a strong understanding of risks and controls of the business area and applications supported.

Collaborates with project management on new initiatives within assigned area of responsibility.

Collaborates with other business analysts to understand interdependencies between areas of responsibility and manages changes to ensure all aspects are covered.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

Banking is a highly regulated industry and you will be expected to acquire and maintain a proficiency in the Bank's policies and procedures, and adhere to all laws, rules and regulations that are applicable to your conduct and the work you will be performing. This position will be responsible for maintaining and ensuring organizational compliance with the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) regulations.

Professional demeanor in appearance, interpersonal relations, work ethic and attitude.

Possess clear, concise, effective written and oral communication skills to effectively express thoughts, ideas and concepts to management, bank employees and bank customers in a collaborative and solutions-oriented manner.

Ability to interact effectively across all levels of the organization, including senior management, the branch network, other departments and vendors.

Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and effectively meet critical deadlines under difficult time restraints.

Strong organizational and prioritization skills.

Team player with a positive outlook.

Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills.

Demonstrated proficiency in basic computer applications such as Microsoft Office.

Ability to learn other banking systems.

Ability to effectively use technological resources for meetings, coaching and training.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

The wage range for the Senior Business Analyst Officer position is $75,000-$80,000 annually. The position includes 22 days of PTO (Paid Time Off), 5 days of STD (Short Term Disability), 11 annual paid holidays and 1 float holiday.

WesBanco has an excellent benefits package to include medical, dental, and vision, Health Care Flexible Spending, Dependent Care Flexible Spending, Transportation Fringe Benefit Plan, Group Life, Long Term Disability, Optional Life, access to voluntary benefit products such as Cancer, Term & Universal Life, Accident, Short-Term Disability and Critical Illness policies, and other ancillary benefit products. WesBanco also offers 401(k) with employee match.

Responsibilities: Employee will work full time remote outside of a WesBanco location (may occasionally attend in person meetings, although primary functions of the role are performed remotely)
Market Mid-Atlantic Work Hours per Week 40 Requirements

The Sr. Business Analyst Officer is responsible for bridging the gap between the changing needs of our external and internal customers and the ever-advancing technological solutions that support those needs

Each Sr. Business Analyst Officer will ultimately oversee their assigned business areas and application(s) to ensure that we are fully leveraging technology to efficiently and effectively meet the user needs
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily
Consults with key stakeholders to determine business objectives and success factors
Collaborates with business area to collect, analyze and evaluate information related to business systems
Documents business requirements, functional requirements, and design specifications
Coordinates with the application analyst counterpart to document technical requirements
Analyzes and manages new and existing system utilization by the end user
Assists in the development of training materials to ensure proper usage and highest optimization of the applications
Serves as an expert in business system solutions in alignment with assigned business area
Serves as a liaison between the assigned business area and third-party vendors and Information Technology (IT) resources
Makes system recommendations and other solution suggestions to meet customer needs and/or improve processes
Monitors system deliverables to ensure business needs are met successfully and within agreed upon timeframes
Assists in troubleshooting problems within the business application solution set and engages IT and third-party vendors as needed
Fosters strong relationships with supporting vendors, IT teams, and supported business area
Opens and tracks support tickets and feature requests
Responsible for the work effort within assigned applications during acquisitions
Tests new functionality and documents test plans in correlation with the business area
Manages the lifecycle of support applications including the roadmaps, releases, upgrades and defect tracking
Maintains a strong understanding of risks and controls of the business area and applications supported
Collaborates with project management on new initiatives within assigned area of responsibility
Collaborates with other business analysts to understand interdependencies between areas of responsibility and manages changes to ensure all aspects are covered
This position will be responsible for maintaining and ensuring organizational compliance with the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) regulations

job_description:
Overview

Business Analyst (Migration Project) / 100% Remote / 12 Month Contract. We are seeking a Business Analyst with deep experience supporting large-scale enterprise migrations, system integrations, and regulated operational processes. This BA will play a critical role in requirements definition, process mapping, data and system coordination, governance support, and readiness activities throughout this complex and high-visibility engagement. The migration aims to modernize and scale the communication fulfillment ecosystem while ensuring regulatory compliance, accuracy, and operational continuity.
Responsibilities
• Support end-to-end migration activities between the legacy provider and new enterprise fulfillment vendor
• Elicit, document, and validate business requirements, workflows, data mappings, and acceptance criteria
• Partner with PMO, technology teams, and Operations stakeholders to support alignment and delivery
• Support integrations across multiple enterprise systems, including:
• Core banking
• CRM applications
• Alteryx
• Batch File Transfer (BFT)
• Content management tools
• Assist with project governance activities, including RAID management and reporting
• Document currentstate and futurestate processes, operational flows, and functional requirements
• Participate in integration testing, proofing, data validation, and regression cycles
• Support operational readiness, go-live preparation, cutover checklists, and Hypercare activities
• Maintain documentation and task tracking using Azure DevOps (ADO)
• Support PMO reporting rhythms, including biweekly status updates (Clarizen) and SteerCo materials
Top Required Skills
• Financial Services / Banking industry experience
• End-to-end large enterprise migration & vendor transition work
• Strong governance, risk awareness, and communication capabilities
• Systems & integration coordination experience across multiple platforms
• Requirements gathering, process documentation, and delivery discipline
• Experience with regulated or high-accuracy customer communications
• Operational readiness, cutover support, and Hypercare involvement
• Hands-on experience with Azure DevOps (ADO)
• Experience with Clarizen or similar PMO reporting tools
Additional Qualifications
• Experience supporting large, complex enterprise migrations
• Experience working in regulated communication environments
• Strong partnership with PMO, Technology, and Operations teams
• Direct involvement in system integrations and data flow mapping
• Experience driving requirements, discovery, and process analysis
• Hands-on experience with ADO for requirements/story tracking
• Familiarity with Clarizen or comparable status and reporting tools
• Strong communication skills and ability to work in a structured, controlled environment
Qualifications
• Must be a strong communicator who can provide clear requirements, documentation, and risk visibility
• Must be adaptable to evolving project needs and able to support multiple integration workstreams
• Must have prior experience in regulated communication environments and complex system transitions
Job Type & Location

This is a Contract position based out of Tukwila, WA.
Pay and Benefits
• Pay range: $60.00 - $75.00/hr
• Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on job classification and length of employment
• Benefits may include: Medical, dental & vision; Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital; 401(k) Retirement Plan; Life Insurance; Short and long-term disability; Health Spending Account; Transportation benefits; Employee Assistance Program; Time Off/Leave
Workplace Type

This is a fully remote position.
Application Deadline

This position is anticipated to close on Feb 6, 2026.

We're strategic thinkers, hands-on collaborators, helping customers capitalize on change and master the momentum of technology. job_description:
Position Overview

At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. We work together each day to foster an inclusive workplace culture where all of our employees feel respected, valued and have an opportunity to contribute to the company’s success.

As a Senior Business Analyst within PNC's Control organization, you will be based in Pittsburgh, PA. This role is within the Regulatory Reporting team.

Responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:
• Assist in the preparation of weekly, monthly, and quarterly regulatory reports
• Analyze regulatory reporting data for accuracy, trends, etc.
• Complete ad-hoc requests, as required
• Operate within the Axiom application to run workflows, complete uploads, export reports, etc.
• Run queries/exports of data to assist in preparation of reports and analyses
• Interpret regulatory reporting requirements and guidance

Key Skills
Along with the core competencies for this job profile, there is an emphasis on the following skillsets:
• Strong attention to detail
• Financial reporting & analytical skills
• Critical thinking
• Ability to communicate effectively

Applications
• Excel
• Hyperion Essbase
• Axiom
• Toad
• Workiva Wdesk

PNC is an in-office company that fosters a supportive culture where employees can thrive and achieve balance. We encourage candidates to connect with their recruiter and hiring manager to understand workplace expectations and ensure the role aligns with their goals.

PNC will not provide sponsorship for employment visas or participate in STEM OPT for this position.

Job Description
• Directs in the research, discovery, collection and interpretation of business requirements, and participates in the development and review of processes and procedures, workflow analytics, and reporting.
• Provides consultation to clients on business designs, problem solving and business analysis to support project management. Develops and maintains of all applicable policy and procedure documentation.
• Independently obtains and identifies the business requirements needed to carry out and improve applicable business processes. Provides expertise and problem-solving for clients and technology teams throughout the business analysis process.
• Translates business needs, processes and/or procedures by partnering with applicable experts and business stakeholders to determine and articulate needs. May communicate with stakeholders and technology teams on moderately complex business requirements, provides gap analysis and facilitates future business process modeling for clients.

PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:
• Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
• Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.

Qualifications

Successful candidates must demonstrate appropriate knowledge, skills, and abilities for a role. Listed below are skills, competencies, work experience, education, and required certifications/licensures needed to be successful in this position.

Preferred Skills
Business Needs, Business Processes, Data Analytics, Decision Making, Management Reporting, Prioritization, Waterfall Model

Competencies
Analytical Thinking, Business Assessment, Consulting, Effectiveness Measurement, Information Capture, Modeling: Data, Process, Events, Objects, Problem Solving, Process Management, Project Management, Requirements Analysis, Software Product Business Knowledge

Work Experience
Roles at this level typically require a university / college degree, with 2+ years of relevant professional experience. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education, job specific certification(s), and experience (including military service) may be considered.

Education
Bachelors

Certifications
No Required Certification(s)

Licenses
No Required License(s)

Benefits

PNC offers a comprehensive range of benefits to help meet your needs now and in the future. Depending on your eligibility, options for full-time employees include: medical/prescription drug coverage (with a Health Savings Account feature), dental and vision options; employee and spouse/child life insurance; short and long-term disability protection; 401(k) with PNC match, pension and stock purchase plans; dependent care reimbursement account; back-up child/elder care; adoption, surrogacy, and doula reimbursement; educational assistance, including select programs fully paid; a robust wellness program with financial incentives.

In addition, PNC generally provides the following paid time off, depending on your eligibility: maternity and/or parental leave; up to 11 paid holidays each year; 9 occasional absence days each year, unless otherwise required by law; between 15 to 25 vacation days each year, depending on career level; and years of service.

To learn more about these and other programs, including benefits for full time and part-time employees, visit pncthrive.com.

Disability Accommodations Statement

If an accommodation is required to participate in the application process, please contact us via email at AccommodationRequest@pnc.com. Please include “accommodation request” in the subject line title and be sure to include your name, the job ID, and your preferred method of contact in the body of the email. Emails not related to accommodation requests will not receive responses. Applicants may also call 877-968-7762 and say "Workday" for accommodation assistance. All information provided will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.

At PNC we foster an inclusive and accessible workplace. We provide reasonable accommodations to employment applicants and qualified individuals with a disability who need an accommodation to perform the essential functions of their positions.

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO)

PNC provides equal employment opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law.

This position is subject to the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (FDIA) and, for any registered role, the Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 (SAFE Act) and/or the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA), which prohibit the hiring of individuals with certain criminal history.

California Residents

Refer to the California Consumer Privacy Act Privacy Notice to gain understanding of how PNC may use or disclose your personal information in our hiring practices.

job_description:
Job Description

Primary Function of Position

The Business Analyst will possess functional understanding of Direct Procurement and Master Data management business processes and will be a key person implementing business processes software solutions and systems implementation in Procurement and Master Data Management on Applications like SAP MM, SAP MDG etc. The role will be of a systems solution expert for identifying, analyzing, refining, translating, and finally documenting business requirements from ISI business teams. Translating the business requirements into Functional requirement specifications, Function design documents and Functional technical specifications. The individual will perform the configuration in the system and be responsible for conducting unit, integration and regression testing.

Essential Job Duties
• Analyze business processes, perform fit-gap analysis as required, and provide ISI business teams with cost efficient proposals on inefficiencies and risks to determine appropriate process and system design.
• Perform hands-on configuration in SAP MM module to satisfy business requirements.
• Create functional specifications and work with cross-functional teams and development teams to deliver the technical objects.
• Review and contribute to design document, configuration documents and functional specifications.
• Conduct unit and Integration and regression testing.
• Support ISI’s procurement processes and all associated business systems functions.
• Work with ISI IT and business teams to optimize and streamline business processes and technical solutions.
• Identify gaps between current and future state of business processes and help in prioritizing opportunities to improving processes through the usage of Business capability matrix (BCM)
• Participate in business user meetings to gather process information to propose sound system solutions.
• Collaborate and provide inputs to the development team during development phase to meet the business needs.
• Help business teams with reporting requirements and work in conjunction with data warehousing team to deliver management reports.
• Conduct QA validations and participate on User Acceptance Testing (UAT) tests.
• Support, assist and train the users on new modified system configurations highlighting the impact on business processes.
• Maintain IT Business system integrity and application notes, system upgrades, changes, and user updates.
• Work closely with onsite team, offshore team, managers, and executives to ensure the release of high-quality solutions.
• Follow the Intuitive change management process. Analyze impact of changes to the corporate application landscape.

job_description:
About the position

Being good neighbors – helping people, investing in our communities, and making the world a better place – is who we are at State Farm. It is at the core of how we operate and the reason for our success. Come join a #1 team and do some good!

Responsibilities

Business Analysts in Agency Recruiting play a vital role in the growth of our agency force by conducting market analysis to identify potential markets and locations for agency placement. They serve as a trusted business partner to Market Area leadership and drive effective execution of the Market Management Strategy by providing guidance, strategic planning, direction and advice to Market Area Leadership. Their expertise of the market, ability to offer key insights into trends and strong relationships with Market Area leadership allow them to develop data-driven recommendations, paired with field intel, to inform agent placement decisions. They have strong business acumen and a clear understanding of how decisions in each market area collectively impact the Enterprise.
This position will be a Hybrid work arrangement for selected candidates already located in our Hubs of Atlanta, Dallas or Phoenix; or our corporate office in Bloomington, Ill. Relocation benefits will not apply.
For San Francisco candidates: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
For Los Angeles candidates: Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

Responsibilities
• Provide recommendations to Market Area leadership on agent placement and agent assignment/investment strategies within each unique market
• Lead regular calls with Market Area AVP/VPAs to share analysis, insights and collaborate on their market management strategy
• Conduct market research to gather data on customer behavior, industry trends, competitor activities and market dynamics and proactively communicate trends with Market Area leadership
• Collaborate with key business partners to provide a holistic assessment of the market, better understand relevant market needs and proactively prepare for upcoming agent openings
• Assess market opportunities and potential for growth by evaluating market size, market potential, economic factors and profit considerations
• Conduct in-depth analysis on extensive data sets, create compelling visual representations and deliver concise yet informative insights and actionable recommendations to Market Area leadership in a digestible format

Requirements
• Ability to influence and build relationships through candid feedback, information sharing, and delivered results; trusted and viewed as highly credible in all situations
• Strong analytical and data visualization skills
• Experience in consulting with Executives or Market Area Leadership
• Curious and creative mindset; desire to delve into unexplored areas/questions for comprehensive analysis and insights and creatively tackle complex problems
• Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration
• Ability to execute and deliver business results under pressure and with a depth of insight
• Ability to assess a situation and proactively take or drive action
• Strong business and technical acumen, willingness and desire for continued learning and development
• Compelling and engaging written and verbal communication and presentation skills with the ability to make the complex simple; adapts communication style as needed for the audience and context
• Proficient in Microsoft Excel
• Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (e.g. H-1B visa) for this opportunity

Benefits
• 401k Plan
• Health Insurance
• Dental/Vision plans
• Life Insurance
• Paid Time Off
• Annual Merit Increases
• Tuition Reimbursement
• Health Initiatives
• Potential yearly incentive pay up to 10% of base salary
• Parental leave
• Paid holidays
• Celebration day
• Life leave (40 hours/year)
• Bereavement leave
• Community service/education support days
• Matching Gift Program
• Good Neighbor Grant Program
• Employee Assistance Fund

job_description:
Business Analysis And Insights Manager

Company Overview:

Walmart is a global retail leader committed to helping people save money and live better. Team plays a critical role in driving data-informed decision-making and business growth across the organization. You will develop and execute data-driven strategies that support operational excellence, improve sales performance, and align with Walmart’s long-term business objectives.

Role and Responsibilities of Business Analysis And Insights Manager:

You will develop business strategies, deliver analytical insights, and drive cross-functional initiatives that improve sales performance and operational effectiveness. In this role, you will use data analysis, financial modeling, and stakeholder collaboration to influence strategic decisions and ensure business goals are achieved.
• Develop business strategies by recommending data-driven initiatives and implementing processes aligned with strategic goals
• Partner with internal and external stakeholders to execute strategies and reassess plans based on performance feedback
• Build and maintain financial models to forecast sales performance and evaluate strategic initiatives
• Design executive-level presentations that communicate sales strategies, performance insights, and recommendations
• Evaluate ongoing effectiveness of plans, programs, and initiatives to improve efficiency and cost-effectiveness
• Provide expert guidance on business analysis best practices and support development and execution of action plans
• Deliver uniform, data-driven reporting and insights to support business strategies
• Identify and assess program and project opportunities through financial and performance analysis
• Establish timelines, workflows, and requirements to ensure compliance and operational efficiency
• Drive execution of multiple business plans by identifying operational needs, removing performance barriers, measuring progress, and adjusting strategies as needed

Required Skills and Experience of Business Analysis And Insights Manager:
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Analytics, Statistics, Finance, Operations, Consulting, or related field
• At least 3 years of experience in an analytical or strategic role such as business analyst, data analyst, consulting, or business development
• OR Bachelor’s degree in Business, Analytics, Statistics, or related field and 2 years’ experience in data analytics, project management, business, or related area
• OR 4 years’ experience in data analytics, project management, business, or related area
• Experience developing financial models and forecasting sales performance
• Ability to communicate findings and recommendations clearly through presentations
• Capability to model and simulate business process improvements and evaluate "what-if" scenarios
• Strong cross-functional collaboration skills and ability to multitask with urgency

Preferred Qualifications:
• Master’s degree in Business, Analytics, or related field
• Project Management Certification
• Six Sigma certification
• Experience with Statistical Programming Language

Compensation and Benefits of Business Analysis And Insights Manager:
• Annual salary range: $70,000.00 – $156,000.00
• Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance bonuses
• Additional compensation for certain positions may include stock
• Health benefits including medical, vision, and dental coverage
• Financial benefits including 401(k), stock purchase plan, and company-paid life insurance
• Paid time off including PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting leave
• Short-term and long-term disability coverage
• Company discounts and Military Leave Pay
• Adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement

About Walmart:

Walmart is dedicated to helping customers live better by delivering value, innovation, and operational excellence. The Walmart fosters a culture of integrity, collaboration, and continuous improvement while investing in associate development and community engagement. Walmart is committed to maintaining a drug-free workplace and upholding high standards of ethics and compliance.

FAQ:

Q: What does a business insights manager do?

A: They conduct market research, analyze customer and competitor data, and provide insights to support business strategy and performance evaluation.

Q: Is being a business analyst a stressful job?

A: Yes, it can be mentally demanding due to solving complex business problems and managing multiple stakeholder needs.

Q: What are the top three skills for a business analyst?

A: Communication, problem-solving, and critical thinking are essential for analyzing data and delivering actionable insights.

Q: Can I become a business analyst without experience?

A: Yes, with strong data analytics, problem-solving, and technical skills, individuals can enter the field even without prior experience.

Qualifications: Required Skills and Experience of Business Analysis And Insights Manager:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Analytics, Statistics, Finance, Operations, Consulting, or related field
At least 3 years of experience in an analytical or strategic role such as business analyst, data analyst, consulting, or business development
OR Bachelor’s degree in Business, Analytics, Statistics, or related field and 2 years’ experience in data analytics, project management, business, or related area
OR 4 years’ experience in data analytics, project management, business, or related area
Experience developing financial models and forecasting sales performance
Ability to communicate findings and recommendations clearly through presentations
Capability to model and simulate business process improvements and evaluate "what-if" scenarios
Strong cross-functional collaboration skills and ability to multitask with urgency

Responsibilities: You will develop and execute data-driven strategies that support operational excellence, improve sales performance, and align with Walmart’s long-term business objectives
Role and Responsibilities of Business Analysis And Insights Manager:
You will develop business strategies, deliver analytical insights, and drive cross-functional initiatives that improve sales performance and operational effectiveness
In this role, you will use data analysis, financial modeling, and stakeholder collaboration to influence strategic decisions and ensure business goals are achieved
Develop business strategies by recommending data-driven initiatives and implementing processes aligned with strategic goals
Partner with internal and external stakeholders to execute strategies and reassess plans based on performance feedback
Build and maintain financial models to forecast sales performance and evaluate strategic initiatives
Design executive-level presentations that communicate sales strategies, performance insights, and recommendations
Evaluate ongoing effectiveness of plans, programs, and initiatives to improve efficiency and cost-effectiveness
Provide expert guidance on business analysis best practices and support development and execution of action plans
Deliver uniform, data-driven reporting and insights to support business strategies
Identify and assess program and project opportunities through financial and performance analysis
Establish timelines, workflows, and requirements to ensure compliance and operational efficiency
Drive execution of multiple business plans by identifying operational needs, removing performance barriers, measuring progress, and adjusting strategies as needed
